duck: Internet Service Provider, an organization that offers users access to the Internet and related services

milestones: Major ISP Level 3 experiences downtime
British ISPs restrict access to Wikipedia amid child pornography allegations
Spanish government to hold ISPs responsible for web content
U.S. ISPs to test restricting heavy Internet users
Google services not loading for users of some ISPs
European Court of Justice rules ISPs not obliged to reveal identity of people suspected of illegal sharing
SAFETY bill would require U.S. ISPs to log on-line user activity
IWF reverses censorship of Wikipedia
Indonesian goverment bans pornographic sites
Broadband users kicked off service for constant questioning
Orcon New Zealand to provide television via Internet
German police seize Tor anonymity servers
Complaint made against internet provider iHug upheld
New Zealand Xtra broadband "unleashed"
Telecom New Zealand reviews itself, finds fault
Consumers' Institute: decline in New Zealand Internet satisfaction
Wikimedia, IWF respond to block of Wikipedia over child pornography allegations
Internet backbone hosts feud, disconnecting users
Outage leaves tens of thousands of New Zealanders without Internet
Japanese court plans to seize control of 2channel

wiki.text:
'ISP' may refer to:

In business:
* ISP Sports, a marketing company which operates several college sports radio
  broadcast networks
* Institute of Sales Promotion, a UK organisation
* Integrated Service Provider, a for-hire firm that performs a variety of
  logistics service activities
* Internet Service Provider, an organization that offers users access to the
  Internet and related services

In computer science:
* ISP Formal Verification Tool, an "In-situ Partial Order" verification tool for
  MPI (Message Passing Interface) programs
* Image Signal Processor, digital camera hardware
* In-System Programming, a way to configure programmable logic devices while
  they are installed in a larger system
* Interface segregation principle, a principle of Object Oriented Design
* Internet service provider, an organization that provides access to the
  Internet.

In education:
* Independent study project
* Information Systems Professional, an information technology title and
  post-nominal
* Instituto Superior Politécnico, a university in São Tomé and Príncipe
* Integrated science program, an honors program at Northwestern University
* International School of Pakistan, a private school in Kuwait
* International School of Paris, a private school in Paris, France
* International School of Prague, an English speaking international school,
  located in Prague, Czech Republic
* Yale Information Society Project at Yale Law School
* Institute for Social sciences of Politics, a research laboratory in political
  sociology and political science at Paris West University Nanterre La Défense
  and École Normale Supérieure de Cachan, France.

In law enforcement:
* Idaho State Police, law enforcement agency of Idaho
* Illinois State Police, law enforcement agencies across Illinois
* Indiana State Police, law enforcement agency of Indiana
* Iowa State Police, law enforcement agency of Iowa

In organizations:
* Independent Socialist Party (disambiguation), in several countries
* Invisibl Skratch Piklz, a group of turntable artists in the early 1990s

In physics and engineering:
* Invariant set postulate, the only postulate joining fractal cosmology with
  quantum mechanics
* Specific impulse, represented by I<sub>sp</sub>, a way to describe rocket and
  jet engine efficiency
* Imperial smelting process, a method of zinc and lead production developed by
  the Imperial Smelting Corporation

In transportation:
* Islip railway station, England, Network Rail station code ISP
* Long Island MacArthur Airport, Islip, New York, IATA Airport Code ISP

In other uses:
* Indigenous sugar cane, polysaccharide<!-- see http://books.google.com/books?id=Q7fAp-
  arpEEC&pg=PA322 -->
wiki.title: ISP%20%28disambiguation%29
